doc.title: Cennet mahallesi
doc.plot: "The Paradise Quarter" is located at the outskirts of Istanbul. A place abundant with dance, music and love. The most beautiful girls, the most swaggering young men, the most talkative, nice and emotional people are living here. The neighborhood beauty Sultan, the dancer, is deeply is head over heels in love with Ferhat (Alisan), the violinist who has an emotional voice. Yet, the enmity starting four generations ago between the two families hinders the two lovers' marriage. Sultan's mother Pembe (Melek Baykal), the cloth peddler and Ferhat's father (Mujdat Gezen), the shrill pipe player were deeply in love years ago, though this enmity has also spoiled their happiness. Grandma (Ayten Erman) the fortune teller, grandpa (Erol Gunaydin) the Saz fixer, 6-year-old Ayse and 8-year-old Alis all contribute to this enmity which nearly makes the police chief (Zeki Alasya) go bananas. Will this enmity ever end?
